title: 5 Missiles Land Near Ship in Red Sea in Likely the Latest Attack by Yemen Houthi Terrorists
message:
DUBAI, United Arab Emirates—A ship traveling through the Red Sea came under repeated missile fire Friday in an attack launched by Yemen’s Houthi terrorists, authorities said, the latest targeting the crucial maritime route.
The missiles landed near the vessel, but caused no damage, the UKTMO added.
Gen. Yahya Saree, claimed late Friday the group made two attacks on ships in the Red Sea, but it wasn’t immediately clear which ship was the one reported targeted by authorities.
The terrorists have targeted more than 60 vessels by firing missiles and drones in their campaign that has killed a total of four sailors.
A Houthi attack also happened Thursday in the Red Sea.

title: Injury Toll In Missile Attack On Vilniansk Grows To 23
message:
(MENAFN- UkrinForm) The number of people in a Russian missile attack on Vilniansk, Zaporizhzhia region, has increased to 23, including eight children.
Ukraine's State Emergency Service announced this on , Ukrinform reports.
"As of 21:20, the number of those injured in the enemy attack has increased to 23, including eight children," the post reads.
The strike killed seven people, including two children.
On the afternoon of Saturday, June 29, Russian forces attacked Vilniansk, not far from Zaporizhzhia.
event_breakdown:
Event 1: Russian missile attack in Vilniansk, Zaporizhzhia region, Ukraine kills 7, including 2 children, on Saturday, June 29, 22:20
Event 2: A Russian missile attack on Vilniansk, Zaporizhzhia region, Ukraine, killed 7 people, including 2 children, on Saturday, June 29, 21:20.

title: Zelensky issues fresh weapons plea after 7 killed in Russian attack on Zaporizhzhia region
message:
CNN —At least 7 people, including children, were killed and at least 31 injured after Russia launched a missile strike on the town of Vilniansk in Ukraine’s southern Zaporizhzhia region on Saturday, according to Ukrainian officials.
“[Today] is a day of mourning in Zaporizhzhia region for those killed in the enemy attack on Vilniansk,” Ivan Fedorov, the head of Zaporizhzhia regional military administration, said on Sunday.
“There is unspeakable pain.”Three children were among those killed and eight children were among the injured, Fedorov said.
In the Donetsk region, Russia has made advances towards Chasiv Yar as it attempts to capture the strategic hilltop town.
As Zelensky repeats his appeals for more long-range weapons, these developments have again highlighted Ukraine’s reliance on ammunition and weapons from the United States and other allies.
event_breakdown: Russia has launched missile strike on Ukraine's southern Zaporizhzhia region on Saturday, killing at least seven including children and injuring at least 31. Russia has also made advances in the Donetsk region, as it continues to attempt to capture strategic hilltop town, Chasiv Yar. These events highlight the Ukraine's reliance on weapons and ammunition from the United States and other allies.

title: Russian missile attack on Ukrainian town kills seven , officials say
message:
Russian forces on Saturday fired missiles at the town of Vilniansk, outside the southeastern Ukrainian city of Zaporizhzhia, killing seven people and injuring 31 others, officials said.
The background: Ukraine's Prosecutor General Andriy Kostin said two missiles were fired on the town, damaging infrastructure, a shop and residential buildings.
On Telegram, the Russian ministry said its missiles had struck a nearby area in Zaporizhzhia region where it said Ukrainian trains unloaded arms and military equipment, killing soldiers and destroying armoured vehicles and missiles.
The key quote: "Our cities and communities suffer daily from such Russian strikes."
Officials said two people in Kherson region, partly occupied by Russian forces in the south, were also killed.
event_breakdown: Russian forces fire missile at Vilniansk, Ukraine outside of Zaporizhzhia, injuring seven people.

title: Lesser Powers Also Use Cross - Border Assassination As A Tool To Execute Policy
message:
After the collapse of the USSR, Russia's Vladimir Putin perfected the art of assassination on foreign soil.
Pakistan, a likely target for India's foreign assassination program, is suspected of carrying out similar murders.
Israel, one of the most frequent employers of extraterritorial targeted killings, appears to have renewed its own assassination program to take out senior Hamas leadership.
However, it was Israel which made assassination abroad a highly efficient tool of foreign policy.
According to The Secret History of Israel's Targeted Assassinations (2018) written by Ronen Bergman, Mossad had carried out hundreds of targeted killings since 2000.

title: U . S ., Europe warn Hezbollah to ease strikes on Israel
message:
U.S., European and Arab mediators are pressing to keep cross-border attacks between Israel and Lebanon’s Hezbollah terrorists from spiraling into a wider Middle East war.
On both sides of the Lebanese border, escalating strikes between Israel and Hezbollah, one of the region’s best-armed fighting forces, appeared at least to level off this past week.
Beginning the day after the Oct. 7 Hamas-led terrorist attack on Israel triggered the war in Gaza, Hezbollah has launched rockets into northern Israel and vowed to continue until a cease-fire takes hold.
Attacks intensified this month after Israel killed a top Hezbollah commander and Hezbollah responded with some of its biggest missile barrages.
Both Israel and Hezbollah, the dominant force in politically fractured Lebanon, have the power to cause heavy casualties.

message:
Police are investigating a stabbing that occurred in downtown Boston on Saturday night.
Boston police said they responded to a report of a person stabbed in the area of Milk and Washington streets at 6:46 p.m.
When they arrived, police said officers located a victim, who was taken to an area hospital with non-life-threatening injuries.
Initial reports were that the stabbing resulted from an altercation over scooters and a possible attempt to steal a scooter.
Earlier in the day, around 1:30 p.m., police received a call for a person stabbed at the South End Whole Foods on Harrison Avenue.

title: Israel Again Targets Family Of Ismael Haniyya , Killing 10
message:
This is the second time during this current nine-month long invasion that the Israeli military targeted Haniyeh’s family for assassination by missile.
It is worth mentioning that, on November 21, 2023, the army killed Haniyya’s oldest grandson, Jamal Mohmmad Haniyya, and his daughter.
On November 10, the army killed Haniyya’s grandchild, Ro’a Hammad, after firing missiles at their homes.
According to the Palestine Chronicle, some family members remain under the rubble, with most of the victims being women.
Although they did not directly mention targeting Haniyeh’s family, the Israeli Army Radio commented on the attack in which family members, including Haniyeh’s sister, were killed.
event_breakdown:
The Israeli army targeted the Palestinian Islamic Jihad Leader's (PIJ) family with missiles, killing some family members, including Haniyeh's sister. 

The Israeli military is trying to avenge the death of an Israeli woman and her daughter who were killed by a Palestinian gunman on Sunday night. The IDF blames the group associated with the slain Palestinian for the incident, although no direct link has been proven yet. These attacks are being noticed worldwide, primarily because they are suspected of being a part of intentional military violence towards a family instead of as a result of targeting by fire on the building.

Update: Because of the threat of attacks from the Gaza Strip, the IDF sent reinforcements to the area. On Tuesday morning, the Israeli military attacked the home of Baha Abu al-Ata, a senior Islamic Jihad commander. After the bombing, a firefight started, and the Palestinian Islamic Jihad group then fired over 100 rockets towards southern Israel.

title: Three Dead , Including Gunman , In Louisiana Movie Theater Shooting
message:
(AP) — A gunman opened fire at a movie theater in Lousiana on Thursday evening, killing three people and injuring at least seven others before shooting himself, officials said.
The shooting happened about 20 minutes into a 7 p.m. showing of the movie “Trainwreck,” The Louisiana Advertiser quoted theatergoer Katie Domingue as saying.
“We heard a loud pop we thought was a firecracker,” Domingue told the newspaper.
Domingue told the newspaper she heard about six shots before she and her fiance ran to the nearest exist, leaving behind her shoes and purse.
The Louisiana shooting occurred three years after James Holmes entered a crowded movie theater in suburban Denver and opened fire during the premier of a Batman film, killing 12 people and injuring 70 others.
event_breakdown: Louisiana Shooting - Gunman opened fire at a movie theater on Thursday, killing three people and injuring at least seven others before shooting himself.

title: 12 killed in Russian attacks on Ukraine . Rescue work continues at destroyed apartment building
message:
(AP Photo/Evgeniy Maloletka) (AP Photo/Evgeniy Maloletka)KYIV, Ukraine — Russian attacks across eastern Ukraine killed at least 11 people Saturday, while rescuers in the city of Dnipro dug through rubble after a Russian strike ripped through a nine-story residential building, leaving one dead, officials said.
The attacks came as Russia continues to stretch out Ukrainian forces in several areas along the 1,000-kilometer (600-mile) front.
He said that Russian forces had shelled populated areas 13 times over the past 24 hours.
Meanwhile, in Dnipro, at least one person died and 12 were wounded, including a 7-month-old girl, after a Russian strike destroyed the top four floors of the apartment building on Friday evening, regional head Serhii Lysak said.
Russian officials also reported Ukrainian attacks, with a drone strike killing five people in Russia’s Kursk region, local officials said Saturday.
event_breakdown: The Russian military opened fire on Ukrainian positions on Saturday throughout the Donbas along the 1,000-kilometer front, while rescuers in the city of Dnipro dug through rubble after an apartment building collapsed due to a Russian strike. One person died and 12 were wounded, including a 7-month-old girl.

title: Expanding extremist groups in Africa fuel worries that they could attack the US , allies
message:
Violent extremist groups linked to al-Qaida and the Islamic State group are growing in size and influence across Africa, fueling worries that as they improve their tactics they could attack the U.S. or Western allies.
While Brown only touched briefly on the terror threat in the region, it was a key topic among others at the conference and spurred questions from military chiefs in the audience after his speech.
At the same time, the Islamic State group has key cells in West Africa and in the Sahel.
A U.S. military airstrike in Somalia on May 31 targeted Islamic State militants and killed three, according to U.S. Africa Command.
Roughly 200 Islamic State insurgents are in Somalia, so they are vastly outnumbered by al-Shabab, which has grown in size to between 10,000 and 12,000.

title: Russia claims 36 Ukrainian drones downed overnight in 6 regions
message:
Moscow's defense ministry on June 30 claimed to have destroyed 36 Ukrainian drones overnight that targeted several regions in the southwest of Russia.

title: Crossbow attacker wounds police officer guarding Israel embassy in Serbia
message:
An attacker with a crossbow wounded a Serbian police officer guarding the Israeli Embassy in Belgrade on Saturday, Serbia’s Interior Ministry said.
Both Serbian and Israeli officials said initial indications pointed to terrorism as a motive.
Interior Minister Ivica Dacic said in a statement that the attacker fired a bolt at the officer, hitting him in the neck.
Israel’s ambassador to Belgrade, Yahel Vilan, said he was deeply shocked “by the terrorist attack” in front of the embassy.
Israel's embassy is located not far from the U.S. Embassy in an upscale Belgrade district.

title: North Korea condemns drills by US , Japan , S . Korea as  Asian NATO
message:
South Korea, the United States and Japan kicked off major new military exercises on June 27, Seoul's Joint Chiefs of Staff said, as the allies seek to counter growing threats from Pyongyang.
SEOUL, South Korea — North Korea denounced on Sunday joint military drills by South Korea, Japan and the United States, calling them an "Asian version of NATO" and warning of "fatal consequences".
"The US-Japan-ROK relations have taken on the full-fledged appearance of an Asian-version NATO," it said, warning of "fatal consequences".
The latest joint drills involved Washington's nuclear-powered aircraft carrier USS Theodore Roosevelt, Tokyo's guided-missile destroyer JS Atago, and Seoul's KF-16 fighter jet.
South Korea has also grown anxious over the North's warming relations with its isolated neighbour Russia.

title: Three Hezbollah members killed in Israeli airstrike on Lebanese village
message:
Beirut: Three Hezbollah members were killed on Sunday in an Israeli airstrike in the southeast village of Houla, a media report said.
An Israeli drone targeted, with four air-to-surface missiles, a two-story building in Houla, killing three Hezbollah members and causing severe damage to neighbouring homes, Lebanese military sources told Xinhua.
For its part, Hezbollah announced that it attacked the Israeli sites of Misqav Am, al-Motella, and Al-Alam.
Tensions along the Lebanon-Israel border escalated on October 8, 2023, following a barrage of rockets launched by Hezbollah toward Israel in solidarity with Hamas’ attack on Israel the day before.
Since the start of the confrontations on both sides of the border between Lebanon and Israel, 553 people have been killed, including 356 Hezbollah members and 100 civilians, according to Lebanese security and medical reports.

title: Zelensky issues fresh weapons plea after 7 killed in Russian attack on Zaporizhzhia region
message:
CNN —At least 7 people, including children, were killed and at least 31 injured after Russia launched a missile strike on the town of Vilniansk in Ukraine’s southern Zaporizhzhia region on Saturday, according to Ukrainian officials.
“[Today] is a day of mourning in Zaporizhzhia region for those killed in the enemy attack on Vilniansk,” Ivan Fedorov, the head of Zaporizhzhia regional military administration, said on Sunday.
“There is unspeakable pain.”Three children were among those killed and eight children were among the injured, Fedorov said.
In the Donetsk region, Russia has made advances towards Chasiv Yar as it attempts to capture the strategic hilltop town.
As Zelensky repeats his appeals for more long-range weapons, these developments have again highlighted Ukraine’s reliance on ammunition and weapons from the United States and other allies.

title: Ukrainian border guards kill armed attacker near Romanian border
message:
Border guards in western Ukraine were forced to defend themselves against an attack by two armed men, killing one of the assailants and injuring the other, State Border Guard Service spokesperson Andrii Demchenko told Ukrainska Pravda on June 30.
The attack reportedly took place on June 29 at around 9 p.m. local time near Selyatyn in Chernivtsi Oblast, which borders Romania.
Journalist Vitaly Glagov said that according to his sources, the attackers were armed with a machete and a gas canister.
The border guard used his weapon to save his own life, Demchenko said.
Romanian police told RFE/RL in May that about 11,000 Ukrainian men have illegally crossed the border into Romania since the beginning of Russia's full-scale invasion.

66-year-old Michael Martin Ochwat was arrested and charged with aggravated assault with a deadly weapon, and taken to the Comal County Jail on June 26.
New Braunfels police say just after noon on June 24, officers responded to a report about a stabbing near the intersection of North Market Avenue and E. San Antonio Street.

Both drivers got out of their vehicles and the suspect, whom police later identified as Ochwat, confronted the victim with a machete-type knife.

title: In the History of War , Tanks With Multiple Cannons Have Always Failed . Until Now
message:
But it has also driven demand for new-built tanks to a level unmatched since the end of the Cold War.
To mitigate the drone menace, French, German and U.S. engineers have now all proposed next-generation tanks incorporating a seemingly outdated and discarded concept: multiple cannons.
In June, KNDS—a German-French conglomerate of defense manufacturers Germany’s KMW and France’s Nexter—unveiled three full-scale concept main battle tanks, all featuring a new main gun called Ascalon.
While tanks with multiple cannons aren’t unprecedented, this design concept mostly vanished post-World War II.
But the remainder, including the turret and main gun, is up for grabs.

title: Royal Auxiliary Airforce centenary : Celebrating Wale squadron
message:
The Auxiliary Air Force, now referred to as the Royal Auxiliary Air Force, recruited civilian air and ground crew who gave up their weekends to train alongside full-time squadrons on operational missions.
By 1937, Wales established its own Auxiliary squadron - Squadron 614, County of Glamorgan.
However, despite the importance of the Auxiliary Air Force, the force wasn’t an easy club to get into – at the beginning at least.
The 614 Squadron was deployed to Scotland to defend against a potential German invasion via a northern route.
614 was the only Royal Auxiliary Air Force squadron selected for that perilous task, which involved missions over not only Italy but also Central Europe and the Balkans.

Part of the anchor from the SS Grandcamp, which was blown 1.62 miles from the ship when it exploded in the 1947 Texas City Disaster, at Memorial Park in Texas City.

A jagged propeller salvaged from the SS High Flyer, which would become a monument near the Texas City Dike.

title: Russian Officials Report 5 Dead in a Drone Strike as a Russian Attack Hits an Apartment Block
message:
KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — A Ukrainian drone strike killed at least five people in Russia's Kursk region, local officials said Saturday, while rescuers in the Ukrainian city of Dnipro dug through rubble after a Russian attack ripped through a nine-story residential building, leaving one dead.
Two children were among the victims of the Ukranian attack in the village of Gorodishche on the Russian-Ukrainian border, Gov.
In Dnipro, at least one person died and 12 were injured, including a 7-month-old girl, after a Russian strike destroyed the top four floors of the apartment bloc Friday evening, regional head Serhii Lysak said.
Discussing the attack in Dnipro, Zelenskyy said it was a reminder to Ukraine’s allies that the country needed more air defense systems.
The Ukrainian air force said Saturday that it had downed 10 Russian drones overnight.

title: Hezbollah drones strike Israeli tank force base - World
message:
Hezbollah has claimed responsibility for a drone attack on an Israeli tank bases in northern Israel.
"Islamic resistance units use combat drones to hit the area of the deployment of the 188th tank brigade of the Israeli army near Revaya.
As a result of the attack, a command center and a barrack of soldiers of tank battalions were struck," Hezbollah said on its Telegram channel.
According to Hezbollah, the drone attack was followed by a fire.
Apart from that, it was that anti-tank guided missiles were used to strike mechanized patrols in Ein Iron, Manara, and Metula.

title: Deadly Russian Glide Bomb Hits Postal Sorting Hub in Kharkiv
message:
(Bloomberg) -- A Russian jet fired a glide bomb at Kharkiv, killing at least one civilian at a mail hub as Ukraine’s second-largest city continues to suffer from frequent aerial strikes.
The bomb targeted a sorting terminal of Nova Poshta, Ukraine’s major private private parcel delivery service, according to a statement from the company posted on Facebook.
The attack highlighted danger to Kharkiv from glide bombs, which are equipped with flight control surfaces that can expand their range.
“Ukraine needs the necessary means to destroy the carriers of these bombs, including Russian combat aircraft, wherever they are.
Early Sunday evening, the regional city administration in Kyiv reported damage to an apartment block in the capital struck by debris from a Russian missile.
event_breakdown: Glide bomb fired at a sorting terminal in Kharkiv by Russia, killing one civilian.

title: One dead in France wedding gun attack
message:
One dead and three critical after gunmen open fire at wedding in FrancePolice at work at the scene of the shooting at a wedding party in Thionville - Jean-Christophe Verhaegen/AFPOne person is dead and another three are in critical condition after masked gunmen opened fire at a wedding reception in north-eastern France early on Sunday.
Police believe the attack outside the Eden Palace hall near Thionville was a targeted assassination, with some sources pointing to drugs.
According to the local paper Republicain Lorrain, a man in his 30s died while being transferred to hospital, and three victims were left in critical condition.
The victims were guests at a Turkish wedding.

title: USS Wasp , Marines enter Mediterranean amid Israel - Hezbollah tensions
message:
The amphibious assault ship USS Wasp entered the eastern Mediterranean Sea this week as the U.S. positions warships to try to keep fighting between Israel and Hezbollah in Lebanon from escalating into a wider war in the Middle East.
U.S. officials said last week that the deployment of the Wasp was likely as the USS Dwight D. Eisenhower aircraft carrier and its air wing left the region.
The Wasp carries F-35 fighter jets, which do short takeoffs and vertical landings, so they can do airstrike missions off smaller ships.
The Wasp also is sailing with the amphibious transport dock ship USS New York, which can deliver troops either by on-deck helicopters or landing vessels.
The San Diego-based USS Theodore Roosevelt will take the Eisenhower’s place.

title: Are Israel and Lebanon Hezbollah edging closer to war ?
message:
A steady, if ugly, tit-for-tat between Israel and Hezbollah since the October outbreak of the Gaza war has been shifting into something more alarming.
While Iran-backed Hezbollah and Israel say they do not want a full-blown war, concern is higher than ever they’re stumbling into one — or will deliberately start one.
Only once Israel and Hamas put down their arms, Hezbollah says, will it be open to its own border negotiations.
And as traumatic as the October 7 attack by Hamas was for Israel, Hezbollah is a much more powerful military force.

title: Russia claims two east Ukrainian villages
message:
MOSCOW: Russia on Sunday claimed two more east Ukrainian villages as its forces have had the upper hand over Kyiv on the battlefield for months.
Moscow has claimed new villages in the east of Ukraine regularly for weeks, as outgunned and outmanned Ukrainian forces struggle to hold them back.
Ukraine said eight people had been killed in 24 hours in villages in the embattled east.
Meanwhile, Russian forces destroyed three dozen Ukrainian drones in areas near the border, Moscow's Ministry of Defence said Sunday.
Voronezh Governor Aleksandr Gusev said on Telegram that air defences had "destroyed several Ukrainian UAVs" and "there were no casualties or damage".
event_breakdown:
List of current events of security reported in the text:
1. Russia claims two more east Ukrainian villages: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Sunday that Russian forces have taken control of two settlements in eastern Ukraine. Putin's statement that Russian military forces had managed to take over several villages came as Ukrainian troops scrambled to hold territory in the eastern cities of Kharkiv and Donetsk.
2. Ukrainian drones destroyed in Russian attacks: According to Moscow's Ministry of Defence, Russian forces destroyed more than three dozen Ukrainian drones in areas near the border. The aerial assault took place amid what Kyiv called Russian "systematic" abuses of human rights and ceasefire violations in the north.
3. Eight dead in villages in east Ukraine: The Ukrainian capital of Kyiv reported on Sunday that at least eight people have been killed in ongoing clashes between Ukrainian troops and Russian-backed separatists in the eastern cities of Kharkiv and Donetsk. The deaths come as the remnants of Kiev's military struggle to regain a foothold in areas taken by militia backed by Moscow.

title: He Was Patriotic To The End , CDS General Musa Mourns Admiral Ogohi
message:
The Chief of Defence Staff (CDS), General Christopher Musa, has said the late Admiral Ibrahim Ogohi, 8th Chief of Defence Staff of Nigeria from 1999-2003, was patriotic to the end.
Admiral Ogohi, who hails from Kogi State, was born in Lafia, Dekina local government area of the State, on November 14, 1948.
He enrolled into the Nigerian Defence Academy (NDA) Kaduna as a member of 4th Regular Course in 1967 and was commissioned into the Nigerian Navy in 1970.
Admiral Ogohi started his military training as a Midshipman in the United Kingdom in 1971 and attended the Sub-Lieutenant Technical Course in India in 1972.
The late Admiral Ogohi held several appointments in the Nigerian Navy, including: Commanding Officer, Nigerian Navy Ship YOLA – 1976 – 1977; Commanding Officer, Nigerian Navy Ships OTOBO and DORINA – 1980, and Commanding Officer, Nigerian Navy Ship EKUN – 1982.

title: Fireworks can torment veterans and survivors of gun violence with PTSD – here how to celebrate with respect for those who served
message:
Fireworks can torment veterans and survivors of gun violence with PTSD – here’s how to celebrate with respect for those who servedFor some combat veterans, the Fourth of July is not a time to celebrate the independence of the country they love.
Along with war veterans, it happens to refugees; to victims of gun violence, rape and other physical assaults; and to survivors of car accidents and natural disasters like earthquakes or tornadoes.
Up to 30% of combat veterans and first responders, and 8% of civilians, fulfill the diagnostic criteria for PTSD.
Flashbacks can be so severe that combat veterans may suddenly drop to the ground, the same way they would when an explosion took place in combat.
How to reduce the negative impactThere are ways to reduce how fireworks affect others:For those with PTSD, the unexpected nature of fireworks is probably the worst part.

title: Ukrainian Ground Forces Destroy Warplane , Three Cruise Missiles , Almost 300 Drones In June
message:
(MENAFN- UkrinForm) Air defense units of the Ukrainian Ground Forces destroyed a Russian Su-25 aircraft, three missiles and 296 drones in June.
Ukrainian Ground Forces Commander Oleksandr Pavliuk announced this on , Ukrinform reports.
According to Pavliuk, Ukrainian forces shot down one Su-25 aircraft, three Kh-101/555 cruise missiles, 42 Orlan-10/30 drones, 46 Shahed-131/136 drones, and 97 Lancet drones.
They also destroyed 45 Zala UAVs, 14 Supercam UAVs, 44 Priver-82 UAVs, and eight Eleron UAVs.
"In conditions of intense hostilities, units of the Ground Forces continue to take down a significant number of tactical UAVs of the enemy, particularly FPV drones, using various means of electronic warfare," Pavliuk said.

title: Remains of WWII pilot to be buried July 8 at Fort Leavenworth
message:
The remains of U.S. Army Air Forces 2nd Lt. John E. McLauchlen Jr., who was killed during World War II, will be interred July 8 at Fort Leavenworth National Cemetery in Fort Leavenworth, Kan. (Defense POW/MIA Accounting Agency)The remains of U.S. Army Air Forces 2nd Lt. John E. McLauchlen Jr., who was killed during World War II, will be interred July 8 at Fort Leavenworth National Cemetery in Fort Leavenworth, Kan.McLauchlen, a native of Detroit, was a member of the 436th Bombardment Squadron, 7th Bombardment Group during World War II.
McLauchlen was accounted for by the Defense POW/MIA Accounting Agency on Jan. 25, 2024, after his remains were exhumed from the National Memorial Cemetery of the Pacific, Honolulu, Hawaii, also known as the Punchbowl, for laboratory analysis and identification.
McLauchlen’s name is recorded on the Walls of the Missing at the Manila American Cemetery and Memorial, an American Battle Monuments Commission site in the Philippines, along with the others missing from WWII.
A rosette will be placed next to his name to indicate he has been accounted for.
McLauchlen will be buried with full military honors, according to a news release from U.S. Army Human Resources Command.
location: Fort Leavenworth National Cemetery, Fort Leavenworth, Kansas.
event_breakdown:
Location: Fort Leavenworth National Cemetery, Kansas, USA
Event: Interment of remains of U.S. Army Air Forces 2nd Lt. John E. McLauchlen Jr., who was killed during World War II, on July 8, 2024, at Fort Leavenworth National Cemetery.

McLauchlen, a native of Detroit, was a member of the 436th Bombardment Squadron, 7th Bombardment Group during World War II.

McLauchlen was accounted for by the Defense POW/MIA Accounting Agency on Jan. 25, 2024, after his remains were exhumed from the National Memorial Cemetery of the Pacific, Honolulu, Hawaii, also known as the Punchbowl, for laboratory analysis and identification.

McLauchlen’s name is recorded on the Walls of the Missing at the Manila American Cemetery and Memorial, an American Battle Monuments Commission site in the Philippines, along with the others missing from WWII.

The interment of McLauchlen's remains will take place at 10 a.m. on July 8th at the cemetery. A rosette will be placed next to his name to indicate he has been accounted for. McLauchlen will be buried with full military honors.
